A few friends suggested this game to me, and I managed to get more people to play. Overall the game is thrilling and fun, especially when you're playing with or against friends. Otherwise it can be quite toxic depending on who you play with/against.

Einmal vorweg, der Spielspaß wird durch teilweise erhebliche Bugs beeinträchtig.
Es braucht etwas Zeit, um die Spielmechaniken zu verstehen. Danach macht das  Spiel einfach unheimlichen Spaß.
Besonders als Killer, mit seinen speziellen Fähigkeiten, wird das Spiel nie langweilig.
Wenn man die Chance hat, mit Freunden zusammen zu spielen, sollte man das unbedingt nutzen. Gemeinsam ist die Hetzjagt ungemein unterhaltsamer.

DBD is a fun and enjoyable game, many characters to use on both killer and survivor side of things. Some of them are iconic faces that we've come to know over decades and some are completely original. There is a learning curve to the game in general based on the play style you choose to go with as well as what the opposing side ends up doing match to match. Perks play a big part in how each match actually plays out.

Playing this game solo is possible as a killer with no problem but as a survivor you will have to deal with the frustration of not always being matched with the greatest teammates to help you escape, so be prepared. Not going into more but I do highly recommend this game.

Takes itself way too seriously for a game of tag. Everything is locked behind this currency or that currency. Rewards are generated on your performance rather than team, which means your sacrifices for the team don't net you as much as just surviving. Not to mention a bad team makes for a bad match. 

All in all, I wouldn't recommend because it's far too nitpicky in several aspects and really takes away from the core mechanics, which would be fun without the 16 layers of crap on top of it.

You a fan of fun? Being spooked? This game is not for you. I got this game a long while ago and as of late they've up and ruined the balance completely. There used to be fun killers, balanced matches, a chance to escape. Today you will find nothing but overpowered killers, zero chance of any win, and just leave upset that half the killers run around invisible and the other half make it so you can't hear them coming anymore. Way to go, you have completely ruined the damn game. I won't be playing anymore and I will never recommend this game to anyone from henceforth.

I'm leaning more on a 70/30 vote for the game. It's only fun when you actually get somewhat decent at the game and have teammates that actually play the objective or can run the killer enough for you to get a generator at least HALFWAY finished.

I see absolutely zero reason as to why ALL of the killers are faster than the survivors. Injured running is the same speed as full health running which makes no sense.

The animations themselves show most of the killers walking but yet their actual speed is ridiculous and they catch up to you jogging. How do you get outpaced by Micheal Myers or Pyramid Head? You don't even see them moving fast in their respective universes.

You basically have to know how to do 360 spins to avoid the dumbass hit registrations that the developers don't know how to fix despite saying that they have.

Other than that, the game is pretty solid minus some other things I wish were better like the animations but that's just me nitpicking since it's 2020 and since this game isn't dead yet, I just kinda expect them to get with the program. 

The game can get low-key addicting sometimes. At least that's how I feel when I win a match and want to continue the streak.

Now that I just said all of that and I think about it, I'm dropping it to a 60/40. :/

Super fun game, but please for the love of god play with friends. You will have a much nicer experience and you will be able to dodge so many toxic players in the process. 
Most survivors and killers are pretty fun, there are certainly exceptions, but perhaps that's because I am so new to the game and I haven't figured out how to deal with them yet.
Game play can get a touch repetitive, but I don't find myself growing that bored with it yet!
All in all, I do recommend.

Tried it out during a free-trail and bought it on sale. Considering I got it for 8 dollars, definitely worth the buy. Looking at it now with over 100 hours, it's worth buying at full price as well. It's fun and you can play it for hours before getting bored, even without buying any extra content, so if you enjoy horror it's a very fun game.

juegazo

Ingredientes de las milangas:

       6 milanesas
       1/2 kilo pechuga
       2 huevos
       C/n Harina
       C/n pan rallado
       Provenzal, perejil, 2 dientes de ajo


P A S O S:

Yo compre un kilo de pechuga con hueso, guarde la mitad y la otro mitad la utilice, corte bifecitos no tan gruesos.. condimentamos con sal... reservamos.. pique dos dientes de ajo...


Añadí perejil picado, provenzal, sal.. 2 huevos.. y batimos...


Colocamos nuestros pedazos de pechugas.. y madamos a la heladera mínimo 20 ' para que guarde el sabor.. tapamos con una bolsa o film
 

Preparamos un poco de harina y vamos pasando todas las pechugas.. por la harina... luego volvemos a pasar por la mezcla de huevo..


Y pasamos por último por el pan rallado.. y a cocinar.. en sartén con aceite caliente.. o al horno con placa y aceite vegetal..


Y a disfrutarlas 💖💖💖❤😉😄😗
